availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nathan G. Dohoney (Adair County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Dohoney and Susanna Childress Dohoney. Married to Ermin C. Price Dohoney in Adair County, Kentucky, on November 8, 1860. Father of Ebenezer Dehoney. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 30, 1861 to January 12, 1865. Wounded in battle in Tennessee in November 1863.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Gradyville, p. 64B-65A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0264.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film 000830576.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 54777.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 861.
"Nathan Gaither Dohoney (1838-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial 27627590, accessed November 28, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27627590.
